intro: Dilophia macrosperma, commonly known as the giant spiderwort, is a herbaceous perennial native to the southeastern United States. It features striking, showy blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are borne in clusters at the ends of the stems, and it is known for its ability to thrive in moist, well-drained soils. Dilophia macrosperma is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits to pollinators.
